title: Spotlights: David Dalaithngu
brief_description: A Yolŋu traditional dancer and actor who changed the way the Australian screen represents First Peoples and their cultural heritage. He reached the pinnacle of success in the 1970s with roles in a string of award-winning films including Walkabout (1971) and Storm Boy (1976).

constellations_primary.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_primary.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu traditional dancer and actor who changed the way the Australian screen represents First Peoples and their cultural heritage. As an actor, he reached the pinnacle of success in the 1970s with principal roles in a string of award-winning films including Walkabout (1971), Storm Boy (1976) and The Last Wave (1977). He also initiated and narrated the film Ten Canoes (2006).
